p.span: Students are accountable for assigned lessons, assignments, assessments, and connecting with their Teachers. Please refer to the schedule below to know when you are to check-in with your Teachers

table.style: margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 750px; height: 243px;

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: GMAIL

h2.strong: To extend student learning, C-VUSD has activated email accounts for students in grades 9-12 beginning Thursday, March 26. If you would like to opt-out your student from having a C-VUSD email account or have questions about the student email accounts, please click this online form:Â

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: Classroom ICON

p.span: Teachers have prepared online assignments on Google Classroom for Academic Courses. Please sign in toÂ Google ClassroomÂ to see your assignments for your respected classes.

Please be on the lookout for additional links for 'distance learning'
Thank you again for your understanding and patience.
If you have never used Google Classroom and need assistance, please refer to thisÂ How to Join a Google Classroom DocumentÂ that will assist you with instructions and a how-to video to set one up.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; color: midnightblue; font-size: large;

span.h2: Click on the links belowÂ to obtain more informationÂ

a.title: Go to comments for Athletics & Forms

span.p: Each year, Covina-Valley Unified School District gathers feedback on the design and implementation of the districtâ€™s priorities for the Local Control and Accountability Plan (LCAP) and Title 1 Plan. To accomplish this, we are asking our parents to complete a short survey. Your participation is critical in this decision-making process, and we appreciate your assistance! Local Control Funding Formula (LCFF) is Californiaâ€™s formula for determining the level of state funding provided to districts to provide for their state-supported general and supplemental programs. The Local Control and Accountability Plan (LCAP) is LCFFâ€™s vehicle for transparency and engagement. It is the way that school districts share performance data, needs, actions, and anticipated outcomes that guide the use of available LCFF funding.

a.title: Go to comments for LCAP Survey

span.h1: "Our quad is open! Thank you to our community for supporting our schools through Measure CC."

span.h2: Covina High School and C-VUSD recognized in national media for an exemplary special education program.

strong.span: How One District Solved Its Special Education Dropout Problem - Huffington Post 11/18/17Â

a.title: Go to comments for SPED Article

span.h1:
Covina High School
Our Instructional Focus
span.p: All students at Covina High School will show measurable growth in their ability to express authentic ideas applied to real-world situations, through speaking, writing and/or artistic expression, as measured by internal and external assessments.
